definition: (name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Having heard the battle drums and horns, it is certain that our troops have started their attack.
sentences.chinese: 耳听得鼓角齐名，想必我们的军队已经开始进攻了。

sentences.english: Yu Opera of Henan, the largest province in China, is only second to Peking Opera.
sentences.chinese: 河南是中国第一大省，豫剧是与京剧齐名的剧种之一。

sentences.english: Have a century of history, along with the Tangshanma tang .
sentences.chinese: 拥有上百年历史，与唐山麻糖齐名。

sentences.english: Earthsea is a fantastic action-adventure saga, which is comparable to the Lord of the Rings.
sentences.chinese: 《地海传说》是一部与《魔戒》齐名的奇幻历险故事。

sentences.english: The Thematic Apperception Test(TAT)is a projective techniqueofpersonality, as well known as theRorschachTest.
sentences.chinese: 主题统觉测验是一种与罗夏测验齐名的人格投射技术。

definition: to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
two remarkable persons living at the same period (as 周瑜[Zhou1 Yu2] and 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4])
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
